com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveFederationFactoryIf

public interface XhiveFederationFactoryIf

Contains methods to create and restore federations.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

Nested Class Summary
static interface XhiveFederationFactoryIf.PathMapper
          An interface that can be implemented to restore federations to directories different from the original location.
 
Method Summary

Method Detail

createPageCache

XhivePageCacheIf createPageCache(int cachePages)
Create a page cache that can be used by multiple federations. The page cache can then be used when calling XhiveDriverIf.init(XhivePageCacheIf).

Parameters:
cachePages - The number of pages in the cache.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

createFederation

void createFederation(java.lang.String bootstrapFilename,
                      java.lang.String logDirectory,
                      int pagesize,
                      java.lang.String superUserPassword)
Create an empty federation. This call will also create any specified directories that do not yet exist. After creating the federation, you will have to set the license key to be able to use it. To avoid mistakes, existing files are never overwritten. None of the files that are created by this method should already exist.

Parameters:
bootstrapFilename - The pathname of the bootstrap file.
logDirectory - The pathname of the directory for the database logs.
pagesize - The pagesize of the federation.
superUserPassword - The initial superuser password.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

deleteFederation

void deleteFederation(java.lang.String bootstrapFilename)
Delete all files that belong to the federation specified in the bootstrap file. This allows creating a new empty federation in the same place or restoring an old one.

Parameters:
bootstrapFilename -
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

restoreFederation

void restoreFederation(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel in,
                       java.lang.String bootstrapFilename,
                       XhiveFederationFactoryIf.PathMapper mapper)
Restore a federation from a backup. To protect the data from accidental overwriting, the restore will fail if any of the database files already exist. To restore incremental backups, first call this method with the last full backup, then call it for each incremental backup in the order they have been created. Beware not to start a server for the federation during this procedure.

Parameters:
in - A previously created backup.
bootstrapFilename - The name of the bootstrap file to restore the backup to. Use null to restore to the same location that the backup was made from. You can use this to restore a federation to a different location or to make a copy of a federation. Any relative paths in the original bootstrap file will be interpreted relative to the new bootstrap file.
mapper - An implementation of XhiveFederationFactoryIf.PathMapper. Useful if you need to restore to a different location (e.g., on another machine) and the bootstrap file contains absolute paths that cannot be used in the new location. Use null to use the paths in the original bootstrap file.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0
See Also:
XhiveFederationIf.backup(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel, int)
